{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3388219,"name":"","username":"four","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-18T16:03:10.368Z","cooked":"

An interesting issue with shuffleboard has arisen. I am able to see a camera stream in PhotonVision Dashboard, but placing a camera on shuffleboard yields a stream that is slow to connect (if it does at all) and prone to freezing. When it does not connect the camera widget will periodically flash its interface. Any ideas here? The only thing I can think of is that shuffleboard is unable to see NT but PV dashboard is.

Did you set your team number in shuffleboard? This correlates to what network address it should be looking for for network data. Without it set to found stuff but it was all really laggy like you described. Once we put our team number in it was a night and day difference.

PhotonVision not working C/C++
This is happening to us as well. We can’t use any selectors or see our camera now… Commenting out the camera server fixes it… But then we can’t see. That can’t be the issue right? That’s the only change. @Peter_Johnson is there something we can do to change the Camera server settings? We used automatic capture which caused the reconnecting spam. Soon as that one line was removed it was fine again. I did notice the port is constantly changing after each attempt [img_9816] Edit: ignore my no…

We also were behind on an update that made a difference as well back at the lab

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Setting global preferences for Shuffleboard

There are a number of settings that set the way Shuffleboard looks and behaves. Those are on the Shuffleboard Preferences pane that can be accessed from the File menu. Setting the theme: Shuffleboa...
